summary: Completed comprehensive testing of Google Auth integration for Moltbot hosting app. All authentication features are working correctly including login redirect, session management, protected endpoints, and ownership-based access control.
passed_tests: Backend: GET /api/auth/me returns 401 for unauthenticated users
Backend: GET /api/auth/me returns user data for authenticated users with valid Bearer token
Backend: POST /api/auth/session endpoint exists and validates session_id
Backend: POST /api/auth/logout clears session and returns success
Backend: POST /api/moltbot/start requires authentication (returns 401 without token)
Backend: POST /api/moltbot/start validates provider and API key with authentication
Backend: POST /api/moltbot/stop requires authentication (returns 401 without token)
Backend: GET /api/moltbot/token requires authentication (returns 401 without token)
Backend: GET /api/moltbot/token returns 404 when Moltbot not running
Backend: GET /api/moltbot/status returns running status with owner_user_id and is_owner fields
Backend: GET /api/moltbot/status works for both authenticated and unauthenticated users
Backend: Multiple users can check status simultaneously
Frontend: Unauthenticated users are automatically redirected to /login page
Frontend: Login page displays 'Sign in with Google' button with Google logo
Frontend: Login page shows Moltbot branding (ðŸ¦ž emoji and 'Moltbot Setup' title)
Frontend: Authenticated users (with valid session cookie) can access setup page
Frontend: Setup page displays user name and profile picture in header
Frontend: Setup page shows provider select, API key input, and Start Moltbot button
Frontend: Logout button is present and functional
Frontend: Logout redirects to login page and clears session
Frontend: Control UI proxy shows 'Moltbot not running' message when accessed without running instance
Frontend: Control UI proxy is protected (requires authentication)
Integration: Session cookie authentication works correctly across frontend and backend
Integration: Bearer token authentication works for API calls
Integration: Ownership tracking is implemented (owner_user_id stored in gateway_state)
Integration: is_owner flag correctly calculated in status responses
